feed.title: Xiaomi Redmi 3: Top features, price and everything you need to know
feed.title_alias: Xiaomi Redmi 3: Top features, specifications, price and everything you need to know
feed.introtext: The Redmi 3 comes with a metal body and a 4,100mAh battery inside.
feed.fulltext:
Chinese company Xiaomi on Monday announced the successor to its popular budget phone Redmi 2, aka the Redmi 3 (in China). The Redmi 2 was popular for its neat specifications set at an aggressive price. In India, the Redmi 2 cost Rs 6,999 on launch. It was followed by the 'made in India' phone, the Redmi 2 Prime with same price but added 1 gigs of RAM. Both the phones have done quite well in India. The Redmi 3 is expected to follow suit.

Here's everything to know about Xiaomi's newly launched Redmi 3:

Hardware and specifications

Design and build quality: The Redmi 3 (unlike the Redmi 2) boasts of an all-metal unibody. This also sets it apart from rivals in its price category. The back panel has a particularly interesting mosaic finish, which is expected to enhance grip. According to Xiaomi, the back panel of the Redmi 3 has been inspired by "the stars in the night sky."

The Redmi 3 has a thickness of 8.5mm and weighs 144 grams. It's thinner than the Redmi 2, but is slightly heavier than it which is quite understandable since it's carrying a much bigger battery inside.

Screen: 5-inch IPS LCD screen with 720p resolution (720x1280 pixels)

Processor and RAM: 1.5GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 616 processor coupled with Adreno 405 GPU and 2GB LPDDR3 RAM

Internal storage: 16GB of inbuilt storage which is expandable by up to 128GB

Operating system: MIUI 7 based on Android 5.1.1 Lollipop

Cameras: 13-megapixel camera on the rear with LED flash, f/ 2.0 aperture, PDAF autofocus and 1080p video recording, 5-megapixel camera on the front

Battery: 4,100 mAh

Connectivity: Dual-SIM supported, 4G LTE connectivity, Bluetooth, GPS, A-GPS, Glonass, GPRS/ EDGE, Micro-USB, and Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n

Pricing and availability: The RedMi 3 has been priced at around $106 in China which roughly translates to between Rs 7,000 to Rs 8,000. It will be available in the colours Gold, Grey, and Silver colours. Xiaomi hasn't announced availability details for the phone yet.
